data.title: Replace upgrade levels with BooleanConditions
data.body:
## Motivation

When the upgrades system was first introduced (#6110, #6556) it used single string conditions as boolean flags for enabling/disabling a trait, with a fuzzy overrideable definition for "can I accept an upgrade of this type" that was used by the stats modifier trait to allow multiple upgrades to increment the applied bonuses.  #6750 overhauled this by changing the upgrade types from booleans to integer levels, and added a framework for turning traits on and off at arbitrary upgrade levels.  This had the very nice benefit of allowing stacked upgrades to activate higher levels of behavior.

As time has gone on it become clear that the benefit of upgrade levels / stacked upgrades is significantly outweighed by our inability to define conditions that depend on non-trivial combinations of upgrades.

As an example, we would like to have the RA radar dome's `ProvidesRadar` trait to be active when:
* The buildup sequence has completed (i.e. not during the make / sell animations).
* The Player is not low-power.
* The building has not been manually powered down.
* A radar jammer is not in range.

This can't be represented using our current upgrade system, but can easily be defined in terms of a boolean expression: `buildcomplete && !(lowpower || powerdown || jammed)`.  We have a number of projects (e.g. removing `IDisabled`, removing the BuildComplete hacks from traits, removing the hardcoded radar jamming logic, finishing TS carryalls) that are stalled over similar syntax problems.

## Discussion

This is going to be a painful migration to complete because it can only be partly automated.  It's not so bad for our default mods because we only use multi-level upgrades for veterancy.  I have heard that other mods rely on these much more extensively, but as far as I know they aren't publicly available so I can't look at their rules.  Based on earlier discussions I expect this to be a controversial change.

The new system will be able to replicate stacked upgrades in two ways:

* A `ConditionCombiner` trait that can (among other things) convert parallel conditions `a`, `b`, `c` (granted in any order) to ordered conditions `1`, `2`, `3`:
```
ConditionCombiner@1
	EnableCondition: a || b || c
	GrantCondition: 1
ConditionCombiner@1
	EnableCondition: (a && b) || (a && c) || (b && c)
	GrantCondition: 2
ConditionCombiner@1
	EnableCondition: a && b && c
	GrantCondition: 3
```

* Making `UpgradeActorsNear`, `GrantUpgradeWarhead`, etc, grant the first disabled upgrade in their type list.  E.g. for a hypothetical "slow" weapon that stacks to two levels
```
GrantUpgradeWarhead:
	GrantCondition: slow-1, slow-2
	Duration: 50
```

The first warhead impact would grant the `slow-1` condition on the target.  The second warhead impact would see that `slow-1` is already enabled, and grant `slow-2` instead.  The third and subsequent impacts would see that all upgrades are already active, and instead recharge the timeout on the shortest one (first `slow-1` then `slow-2` and so on).  This can be combined with `ConditionCombiner` on the target actor if the modder wants the warhead to trigger multiple conditions on the target actor.

This overhaul is explicitly trading off convenience for the stacked upgrade case for the ability to solve a lot of problems that currently aren't possible.  I have tried to cover all the bases in this PR introduction because I want to avoid a rehash of the ill-informed argument when I first outlined this plan in IRC a few months ago.

data.title: upgrade freeactor trait
data.body:
freeactor trait now can give one unit.
And if add to freeactor trait interval and maximum unit count fields, it may close #151
it may spawn units every interval value and while units count < max count value.

data.title: Add a boolean expression parser
data.body:
This adds a quick and dirty (but still relatively efficient) parser for strings that define boolean expressions over runtime-defined variables.  It supports AND/OR/XOR/NOT and parentheses.  This will be used in future PRs that overhaul and simplify our prerequisite and upgrade declarations.

This comes with unit tests that verify correctness, so I'm hoping this will be a quick an easy review.

data.title: Rework resolved MiniYaml outputting utility commands
data.body:
~~This is exactly like printing out the rules tree for an actor except it is for sequences.~~

**New description**:

This completely reworks printing out the merged yaml tree for rules (and includes sequences and weapons).

data.title: Fixes issue with rocket soldiers wandering
data.body: Fixes #12368

data.title: Infantry shoot animation freezes (All mods)
data.body:
If infantry stops shooting, the attack animation freezes for a while until the idle animation comes to the scene. This bug affects all mods (including RA2)

The bug is not so visible in older titles (RA, TD, D2K). In TS you can see it better. It's clearly visible in RA2 (muzzle flashes freezing and so on). Got muzzle flash frozen in D2K (with Trooper unit), too.

To reproduce:

1) Hold ctrl + attack random target (e.g. terrain) with an infantry unit
2) Give a sudden stop command to the unit while it's shooting
3) Unit freezes for a moment until idle animation continues

-----------------------------------------
For RA2, a custom hotfix (https://github.com/Fincer/openra-tibsunra2/blob/master/data/hotfixes/linux/hotfix-infantryanimations_shoot.patch) for shoot animations were applied first to fix https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/322

data.title: Save spectator-only chat for spectators
data.body:
In replays, spectator-only chat is not saved, even when spectating during the game. 
Some interesting conversations can be lost ... 

Would it be possible for spectators to keep the chat in the replays ? While the players still don't see it.

data.title: Bug when trying to deploy concrete walls on moving units
data.body:
Hi all,

I don't know if there's a system log or a replay that can prove this, but I have found that deploying a (single) concrete wall on top of a moving unit stops the wall from being placed, and takes away the money I spent on the wall. 
This has happened in several games where I have used the walls to block pillbox fire, but a rifleman or another unit moved into the build zone right as I had placed it, and then both my wall and my money disappear. 

Although this is a minor issue, it is kind of annoying since I just lost $100 that could have gone towards a pillbox (lol).

data.title: Add damage/demolition/repair support to ground-level TS bridges.
data.body:
This takes us another step along the path to resolving #3654, #8916, and #12310.

This only implements the world logic for the bridges.  The artwork selection and FrozenUnderFog changes will come later.  Once these are finished then we can port RA/TD over to the new system and remove the horrible now-legacy code.

Ghost Stalker has C4 for testing demolition.

data.title: Implement heightmap-visibility blocking
data.body:
This implements a `CellLayer` that calculates (the best that we can) and caches the effective height for each projected cell.  It then enables a +3 height cutoff for units in TS, matching the original game.

![shroud](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/20424101/ffcf8702-ad6b-11e6-8e6d-6b2ce7cc38ea.png)

data.title: Add an introduction dialog for non-{DEV_VERSION} TS builds.
data.body:
![dialog](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/20218579/32316aca-a81d-11e6-80cc-a4d3353f5573.png)

This adds an introduction prompt in preparation for a future oramod release.  Test by running `make version` to change the mod version away from `{DEV_VERSION}`.

data.title: Suicide behavior of rocket soldiers
data.body:
Rocket soldiers tend to get themselves killed by wandering away from the group to chase down enemy ground units. This is very annoying.

This occurs because the AutoTarget ScanRadius defaults to the unit's max weapon range. Since the rocket soldier has two different weapons with two different ranges, it uses the one with the longest range. This makes rocket soldiers chase ground units with a scan radius of 7.5 cells (AA range) instead of 5 cells (AG range). 
Setting their ScanRadius to 5 cells should prevent this excessive chase behavior.

OpenRA\mods\ra\rules\infantry.yaml
E3:
+AutoTarget:
++**ScanRadius: 5**

Source infantry chase behavior:
OpenRA\mods\ra\rules\default.yaml
^Soldier:
+AutoTarget:
++ScanRadius: -1 ([default to maximum weapon range](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#autotarget))

data.title: Add message to fixheader.exe target if Mono isn't installed
data.body: Hopefully this will help with issues like https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/301

data.title: Game times do not agree when game is set to "faster"
data.body: At the end of a "faster" game, the game clock in the top right corner shows a shorter time than the x axis on the "earnings" graph. My previous game shows 61 minutes graphed but the game clock in the top right shows 46:19.

data.title: Air AI units attacking Cruisers forget to reload
data.body: I took a swarm of cruisers down the coast and a handful of AI air units came and attacked. When they ran out of ammo they continued to swarm rather than reloading.

data.title: Dedicated Server no longer allows single player
data.body: The new dedicated server does not allow starting games with a single human player. Tried both Server.DisableSinglePlayer=False (from web page) and Server.EnableSinglePlayer=True (from man page).

data.title: Allow choosing which monitor the game should use, on multi-monitor systems
data.body: This requires a bit of extra SDL plumbing to do properly, but is straightforward.

data.title: Crash in Survival02 mission
data.body:
Hey guys,

Trying to figure out a fix for a crash that keeps re-occuring in survival02 mission when bombs drop from the bombers right before the final wave comes in.  I tried to search through the forums for an answer but the one thread I found wasn't clear on the fix.

I generate this exception log:

Red Alert Mod at Version release-20161019
on map 85e6243ee3c8d6aa7c6634a805678e30a508243b (Survival 02 by Nuke'm Bro.).
Date: 2016-11-08 01:46:47Z
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Unit `bomblet` does not have a sequence named `open`
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SequenceProvider.GetSequence(String unitName, String sequenceName)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.GetSequence(String sequenceName)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.PlaySequence(String sequenceName)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.PlayThen(String sequenceName, Action after)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Projectiles.GravityBomb..ctor(GravityBombInfo info, ProjectileArgs args)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Projectiles.GravityBombInfo.Create(ProjectileArgs args)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Armament.<CheckFire>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__1()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Armament.ScheduleDelayedAction(Int32 t, Action a)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Armament.CheckFire(Actor self, IFacing facing, Target target)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackBomber.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__3(TraitPair`1 x)
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

'preciate it!

data.title: Map editor sidebar tooltips are flickery
data.body: The tooltips flicker in and out of existence as you move the mouse across the sidebar.

data.title: Remove DelayedAction from NukePower
data.body:
The recent Shroud refactoring now allows us to reveal shroud via an effect. This in turn allows us to replace the `NukePower.CameraActor` and `DelayedAction` with a time-limited `RevealShroudEffect`.

Note: For now, I'm not doing the same for other SupportPowers, because 
a) they don't use DelayedAction, and 
b) in some cases the spawned camera actors perform stealth detection too/instead.

Contributes to #12310.

data.title: Add map bounds checks to TerrainSpriteLayer and SmudgeLayer.
data.body: Fixes #12329.

data.title: Remove DelayedActions from Demolish activity

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
By adding delay support to `FlashTarget` and `Demolishable`.

Contributes to #12310.

Fixes #12359.
